#summary This user guide describes Google Docs Notifier 1.0.

== Introduction ==

Welcome to the user guide for Google Docs Notifier! These guides are designed to help you understand how to use the features in Google Docs Notifier. Just follow the handy guide below and enjoy the journey!

Before you start, you may want to know more about [http://docs.google.com/support/bin/topic.py?hl=en&topic=15114 Google Docs].

==Getting Started==

===Downloading and Installing===

*NOTE* Make sure you are running a Windows operating system (Windows XP, Windows Vista or Windows 7).

Installation steps are as follows:
 # Uninstall previous versions
 # Run the Google Docs Notifier installer (Download here: http://code.google.com/p/googledocsnotifier/downloads/list)
 # Follow the setup instructions
 # Done, Google Docs Notifier is now successfully installed on your computer

If you encounter any difficulties while installing, please contact me.

===Getting Around===

You can find the shortcut of the Google Docs Notifier in the Start Menu after you install it.

[http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~gohchunl/UserGuide_01.png]

In the login screen, you just have to key in the user name and password of your Google Account. If you do not have one, please register it [https://www.google.com/accounts/NewAccount here] for free.

[http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~gohchunl/UserGuide_02.png]

After logging in, you will be redirected to the page where you can see a list of newly updated documents in your Google Docs. To view the document, you just need to double click on the name of the document.

[http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~gohchunl/UserGuide_03.png]

If there is any document in Google Docs being updated, you will also be notified. Double click on the "Red Rocket" icon to view the list of newly updated documents.

[http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~gohchunl/UserGuide_04.png]
